channel.title: Mastodon Home Timeline
channel.description: RSS feed for the Mastodon Home timeline

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
Nice results. You can't understand cortex w/o the thalamus
Primate thalamic nuclei select abstract rules and shape prefrontal dynamics
https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2024.03.13.584871v2
#Neuroscience
They also find a spectrolaminar cortical motif like this study:
https://www.nature.com/articles/s41593-023-01554-7

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: LFI dépose un amendement pour taxer l'utilisation des animaux pour la recherche. L'argumentation est affligeante.https://www.assemblee-nationale.fr/dyn/17/amendements/0324A/AN/2458

item.title: Michael E. Mann :verified:
item.description: "At COP29, the Sun Sets on U.S. Climate Leadership" by @elizkolbert for @newyorker: https://www.newyorker.com/news/the-lede/at-cop29-the-sun-sets-on-us-climate-leadership

item.title: lashman
Signal
item.description:
We’ve improved private group video calls in Signal with new features, incl. call links.Create a link that anyone on Signal can use to join a group call *without* having to join a Signal group chat first+ raise hand, emoji reactions, calls tab, & more
https://signal.org/blog/call-links

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: The gamma-graphyne story is a wonderful example of how PubPeer can serve as a community early warning system. In-depth analysis was posted 3 years ago. This year one paper was retracted (with an unsatisfactory notice) and a replication failure has just been published. I wonder whether the journal Carbon will finally do the right thing. The official channels are still such a slog.https://pubpeer.com/publications/62F65CE8172CCF660E7A80D26CB704https://pubpeer.com/publications/D61E14AE77538E1599BD7D2F394767

item.title: steve mookie kong
item.description: This is really a nice new (for me) feature of #Mastodon, the Author Attribution. I set it up on my blog after I got my new instance up and only just noticed what it did with my new post about Mission: Impossible.To set it up, you'll add a meta tag to your HTML for content that you're generating. The information can be found on your Mastodon preferences here:Public Profile -> Verification -> Author attribution#blog #content #author

item.title: Gary Marcus
item.description:
Trump got 50% of the US vote
80% of the X voteX does not represent America.

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: However, it is positive that the authors of the replication got a publication with the same prominence as the original.

item.title: Andrea Chalupa
item.description: Have faith in a higher power: whatever that may be for you. Have faith in your inner light. You are not alone. Ideas, like democracy, are powerful, and cannot be killed.

item.title: Jan Rosenow
item.description: I keep hearing that heat pumps are a niche technology and will never take off.Look at the market share of heat pumps in different European countries - in 8 countries most new heating systems installed are now heat pumps.

item.title: MEActNOW
item.description: Men, are you ready to track your 'Manstrual cycle' for the women in your lives!?

item.title: Aloniaxx
item.description: For non-Brits this is really much too hard to explain for numerous cultural and humour reasons without pissing off a huge number of people.

item.title: Stuart Celarier
item.description:
Happy Exploding Whale Day! On this day, 54 years ago, Oregon State Highway Division decided to remove a stinking dead whale from the beach near Florence using a half ton of dynamite. Hilarity ensues.
https://youtu.be/V6CLumsir34

item.title: SocProf
item.description: Study estimates 64,000 pregnancies from rape in states that enacted abortion bans post-Roe | PBS News https://www.pbs.org/newshour/show/study-counts-64000-pregnancies-from-rape-in-states-that-enacted-abortion-bans-post-roe Regular reminder to women of child-bearing age: get fitted with a long-lasting contraceptive. Stay outta the red states, if you can.

item.title: Corey S Powell
item.description: Taking a break from awful things:Scientists taught rats to drive cars. The rats quickly learned to rev the engine and take longer routes just for fun. Bonus: Watch the researcher do a little happy leap when the rat gets into the car.https://theconversation.com/im-a-neuroscientist-who-taught-rats-to-drive-their-joy-suggests-how-anticipating-fun-can-enrich-human-life-239029 #science #tech

item.title: Kit Yates
item.description: "We will no longer post on any official Guardian editorial accounts on the social media site X. We think that the benefits of being on X are now outweighed by the negatives and that resources could be better used promoting our journalism elsewhere."https://buff.ly/4hLmYHe

item.title: Hilda Bastian
item.description: This is the graduating class of 1916, chemistry division, Tohoku Imperial University. There, at the end of the 2nd row, is the first woman to achieve a bachelor of science in Japan.Her name was 黒田チカ, Chika Kuroda (1884-1968) & she was the daughter of a samurai...1/6#WomenInSTEM #tbt
